questions.question_text: Which two are elements of a singleton class? (Choose two.)

choices.C: a public static method to return a copy of the singleton reference
choices.D: a private constructor to the class
choices.E: a public reference to point to the single instance
choices.A: a transient reference to point to the single instance
choices.B: a public method to instantiate the single instance

discussion.content: C,D, not B otherwise could keep calling that public method and instantiate multiple times

Selected Answer: BD
Band D. it needs the public method not public static . public static method always returns a copy of it.

Selected Answer: CD
C and D are correct since we need static method to return instance of singleton and private constructor so that it is not possible to create multiple instances.

it is BD because constructor has to be private to prevent instantiation and also there must be a method to check if there is already an object of it to provide otherwise create a new one.
